title: 别墅丨越南白色住宅(2010)(H.a)设计
text:
Houses, House Interiors, Vietnam
设计师：H.a
 面积：  180 m²
年份：2010
摄影：Quang Dam
设计团队：H.a
Construction:Gia Phat Hung
Structure:Minh Lam Company Limited
Iron:Tai Loi Company Limited
Country:Vietnam
The house on an area of ​​5x18 is the home of 4 members. It is a story about the house of a young couple who just returned from studying abroad and are living with their parents, wishing to have a house with its own characteristics, expressing new personality as well as new thoughts about space. living.
The initial description of the house as a joke: "love white and curves", but it is an interesting and inspiring topic for the design team. The love of the house, along with the 2am talk and talk sessions of the design team and the homeowner, have created a house that is closest to expectations.
Open spaces are connected with large floor clearance, curves are used to create a rhythm as well as the continuity of the floor - wall - ceiling creating structures that sometimes like float, sometimes like wavy, and accumulate every time the perspective changes.
The curves combined with the main material are terrazzo together with the light effects from the large windows, create a soft and clear living space but very cozy as it connects all members of the family. The house is not too ostentatious, but enough to give a lasting impression to those who have passed through the neighborhood. During the day it is like melting in the sun, and at night it is shimmering with cozy colored lights. 
The result is a house of peace, with the owner it is satisfaction and an adventure, and for the design team, it is enthusiasm and passion. Above all, it is the trust and enthusiasm of both for each other and for the house.
项目完工照片 | Finished Photos
设计师：H.a
分类：Houses
语言：英语
阅读原文

title: KPF丨公寓建筑丨2 Waterline Square Building
text:
Through creative planning and massing adjustments within the strict confines of a previously approved scheme, KPF achieved the client’s brief, weaving together 646 units total (160 condo, 216 rental) with plentiful outdoor space and amenities.
Sited between the Hudson River and the dense urban fabric of the Upper West Side, 2 Waterline Square accommodates a blend of luxury condominiums, market-rate rental apartments, and affordable housing units. At the ground level, it activates the neighborhood with a mix of retail and amenities, complementing the vitality of nearby Columbus Circle and Lincoln Center. Meanwhile, terraces and outdoor living spaces, in conjunction with the park at the center of the development, mediate between the density of the city and the openness of the riverfront.
To avoid an overwhelming “superblock” scale, the massing of the building is broken down. The two towers are connected by staggered volumes with multiple corners to bring light and air to all the units. The central lobby further breaks down the building’s scale by opening up the podium to take full advantage of the park to the south and pull additional daylight into the building.

title: 170㎡有温度的私宅，成熟有韵味！
text:
Sergey Makhno Architects新作，面积170
，位于乌克兰基辅住宅区Obolon Residence ，
Alexander Bokhan
计，在空间质感上精雕细琢，凸显品味与个性，传达一种充满“精英感”的生活态度。
这是一对年轻夫妇公寓的最终设计方案，整个空间只要以木色和灰色的搭配，整体设计无不透露着一种简洁大方，色泽搭配和谐自然，很是干净。
设计师任务是创建一个现代和舒适家，室内色调温暖，
厨房里有一盏来自 serhii makhno 陶瓷作坊的手工台灯，卧室床头有设计师设计的嵌板。
许多隐藏的存储区域，以保持空间清洁。
最重要的是，这个公寓的每一个早上或晚上的场景都是精心设计的。玄关，线条简洁硬朗，隐形的衣柜，
设计师使用浅灰色、米色和黑色，用光线填充空间，
为了创造一个极简主义风格的和谐空间。
设计师很注重自然光线，在主卧里，设计师利用自然光和人工照明，把光源利用到极致，
在这里，艺术与功能并不矛盾，
舒适温馨、大气简约，诠释着业主对美的品味追求。
步入式衣帽间现代时尚，不需要打开所有的壁橱，去找一样特定的东西，只要走进房间就能看到，这样的计划显然会节省时间。
没有过多的装饰是这卫生间的主要特点之一，巧妙搭配自然质感的石材以及灯光元素，赋予空间生动的魅力。
次卧采用浅灰色调，自然非凡，精致的气韵在此间静谧地生长，让内心得以片刻的安放与升华。
卫生间时尚前卫的背景，洗手台精致优雅，空间更有艺术感。
书房硬朗与柔软的纵横，粗糙与细腻的交织，材质间的对垒使得整个空间扑面而来一股高级的气息。
Alexander Bokhan
Sergey Makhno Architects，乌克兰设计与建筑工作室，从0平方米开始设计空间，一米一米地创造新世界，为了使周围环境更加美丽，将设计变成了艺术，不仅是观赏，而且是生活。
BY THE SEA HOUSE
Alexander Bokhan的海边别墅概念设计，极简主义的实用性和约束力，高雅的古典风格以及经过验证的比例，严格设计中的创新和大胆技术-所有这些都可以用一个词形容 -新古典主义。这种风格的高贵和内敛的装饰看起来并不保守-它是多方面的，并且不怕创新。但是为了不弄错定义，有必要了解新古典主义的特征。
如前所述，壁炉是整个内部空间的中心。
这是现代经典内饰中不可或缺的组成部分，没有它，风格就不是其本身。
除了执行美学功能外，壁炉还是一个温暖的家，它不仅可以加热空间，还可以将整个家庭聚集在自己的周围。
与家人和朋友一起聊天，喝杯好茶并在客厅观看篝火真是太好了！
新古典主义吸收了经典的精华，拥有拱门，古董柱子，大理石，水晶枝形吊灯，造型，烛台，雕塑和镜子，装饰华丽。灰泥造型将作为一种特殊的装饰，即使是冷漠的观察者也可以将其迷住。
天然材料与现代材料的结合使用，将现代经典内饰风格与经典保守主义区分开来的特征之一。
因此，大理石，花岗岩，陶瓷和凝灰岩将是出色的天然助剂，即使与简单的塑料完美结合。
镶木地板非常适合地板，天花板可以在树下用装饰板装饰。
无论您配备什么房间，无论是旧房子还是带有全景窗户的全新公寓，这种方法都将适用于任何地方。
作为18世纪和19世纪内部不可或缺的一部分，capitone在新古典主义中得到了体现，并获得了广泛的欢迎。
如果说早先主要是扶手椅和沙发是缝的，例如著名的切斯特菲尔德（Chesterfield），现在则涉及墙板，瓷砖，床垫，甚至还包括管道外部。
对于以现代经典方式划分公寓内部空间的区域，在这里有必要放弃大量的小房间并创建一个大房间。
这将是整个作品的条件中心，同时又是一个宽敞的客厅。
此组合房间应能从一个房间顺利过渡到另一个房间。
圆柱和半柱可以很好地区分区域，门可以用拱形或半拱形代替。

title: 帕里姆·维杜住宅(2020)(Meister Varma Architects)设计
text:
Houses, Chendamangalam, India
设计师：Meister Varma Architects
 面积：  880 m²
年份：2020
摄影：Syam Sreesylam, Govind Nair
建造商： AutoDesk, Hafele, Adobe, Saint-Gobain
设计团队：Krishnan Varma, Saumya Joseph
合作者：Roji Antony, Shaijan PV, Shaji Francis
City:Chendamangalam
Country:India
The Paliam family patriarchs were hereditary prime ministers to the erstwhile Kingdom of Cochin, Kerala. Today the ancestral home and palace of this family is a heritage complex about an hour’s drive from the city of Cochin. The client who got a small parcel of 160 sqm in the family partition decided to build a vacation home on it.
The brief was to design a home that could host their frequent visits and double up as accommodation for the multitude of classical artists and performers who grace the annual family festival. The layout is largely informed by this, keeping bedroom areas to a minimum and giving over the living areas to an open plan layout. The circulation passage doubles up as access to the heritage complex behind which otherwise would get blocked with this new construction. The design takes a cue from the traditional Kerala architecture around but introduces a gable to contain the building edges. A rainwater channel in polished cement replaces the eaves and helps direct water in a more controlled way for storage.
This structural channel is repeated in each bay giving long lintel-less windows in all the rooms. Jackfruit wood salvaged from traditional houses is used as a grill for shading and security. Glass roof tiles delineate the passage through the house and animate the interiors with ever changing light patterns on the floor.
项目完工照片 | Finished Photos
设计师：Meister Varma Architects
分类：Houses
语言：英语
阅读原文

title: HS空间设计 × 轻时系列：让美学与日常同行
text:
AESTHETICS OF DAILY LIFE
本案的使用者是一对年轻夫妇和小男孩，在初期的接触中就定下了“干净”的基调，不使用仅为装饰的物件，一切都与日常连结在一起，每一个构件都依靠自身提供感受，避免多余物件带来过于饱和的视觉张力。而这种“干净”来源于具象属性与抽象属性两个方面，前者是形式上的简化，后者是感受上的提炼。
L形的集中储物，减少了零散柜体对空间二次的切割，与顶面的“错位”隐含着填充的假象，成为“矩形体块”镶嵌在空间中，借此让空间再度舒展开来。
生活亦是不变，亦是无常，两者的界限总是由时间来划定，哪里放了什么，生活会造就自己的习惯。宜人的方式应该具有一定的被动性，做好一个“接纳者”，这样的关系才能造就住宅的“善意”。
在厨房并不需要高谈阔论
收拾碗筷也可以请他递过来
厨房使用杆件作为分割，这种低存在感的语言很安静，如同语言中的“逗号”，静默却又真实存在。灰色的体块脱离顶面，让空间持续流动延展，同时作为空间中抵消“正面性”的存在，创造了关系上的通透性。
日常的生活就在这回型的动线中依次展开，厨房的灯火延展到客厅中，客厅的人确实能在这一缕余辉中找到家
存在，而这一种认定也确实能找到依据所在。
沙发适宜的坐高，低矮的线形灯经过粗糙的表面呈现出一种柔和的感受，并且在尺度上更具包裹感与亲切感。在这个家人长时聚集的空间中充满了包容性与“善意”，沙发的模块化带来了更多的可能性。
面对日常的循规蹈矩，或许哪一天，尝试一种面对面的生活格局，在生活的“囫囵吞枣”中慢下来，认认真真地聊一次。
与公共区域产生一定的联系
为私密区域提供一定的遮挡
肌理粗糙的矮墙从材质与形式上孤立于公共与私密之间，一面为客厅提供包裹感，一面作为私密的功能区，在作为更强烈的分割语言的同时也完成了与木饰面背景关系上的通透性。
而墙面的木饰面如同臂弯一般将本来流动的空间揽在“怀中”创造了一定的空间静止性，而这种静止性意味着更慢的运动趋势。从这里开始，为进入完全包裹的空间提供了体验的前奏。
但功能的切割可以提供更多的可能性
分开的洗漱和如厕功能会更具“可能”的为屋主提供服务，清晨是忙碌一天的起始，首先被需要的就是这小小的卫生间，而生活也包夹在这平凡的匆忙中。
粗糙的墙地肌理也为此提供了一定的原始意味，
经过一天的疲惫，在沐浴中暂时脱离“光鲜亮丽”而得以恢复元气。
深色创造静谧的睡眠环境
同时模糊边界，一定程度柔化空间
生活并没有想象中来得诗意，也不在刻意的仪式中，如果你仔细看看，或许它就在一杯可乐中，一份简单的早餐中，一句来自身边人的关怀中，而我们可以在生活中做一个“接纳者”，为他人留出可能性，这种可能性或许在某个清晨会以一种意料之外的惊喜回馈给你。
HS空间设计/独立设计师
ABOUT DESIGNER
致力于空间体验与美学日常化

title: All Design Studio丨服装店丨Crème Boutique
text:
Crème Boutique is a high-end womenswear retail space and shopping experience in Hangzhou, China. The store boasts curated high-quality products exhibited with a chic backdrop designed by ALL Design Studio, led by design directors Liang Liang and Hugo Meyer. Liang, known for his designs of Beijing’s Maison Margiela and Dior pop-up boutiques, and Meyer, who designed the Abu Dhabi presidential campaign hall, collaborated to bring a contemporary and monastic-like experience to Hangzhou’s luxury retail landscape. 
The name “Crème” (cream in English) was inspired by the original color of cashmere, which is the main product of the shop. Additionally, cream is known as the finest part separated from milk, a parallel to cashmere as the finest form of wool. 
The design of the space is based on the texture and color of the cream, bringing a vision of softness and refinement to the store. The main shape was inspired by a  double-layered cream cake.
The shop is located on the ground floor of a department store, a rectangular space with 120 square meters and 6 meters floor height. To attract guests into the space, the designer embellished the door handle with a vibrant light. AnAnarc-shaped wall at the entrance leads the customers first to the coffee lounge area. Overlapping changes at the end of the arc-shaped wall and light were used to draw a shape of “C,” which is another visual nod to the name of the store.
To maintain an openness to the space, the designer increased the size of the mezzanine to the edge of the space. In order to create the best shopping experience, the designer considered the flow of guests in the space, so the designer chose an arc-shaped fitting room in the center. At the end of the space, the designer used a contrasting blueberry color as an unexpected surprise for visitors. The jewelry window inside the blue/purple space symbolizes gems inside a jewelry box. This colorful area includes a lounge area, fitting room and an accessory display. The space could also be a private area for VIP customers. Within the space, there is also a door that leads to another cream-colored space outside. It is designed not only for customers but also sales representatives to reach out to the main shopping area without interrupting other VIP customers inside the space. 
The designers chose to use a crisscrossed arc-shape pattern on the ground to mirror the texture of cream. Soft toned rose-colored marble was selected to emphasize the checkout counter. The large windows inside the shop provide sufficient light to the space, so the designer chose to set up a coffee lounge here to upgrade the shopping experience. The maroon color spiral stairs leads to an office upstairs. It was also designed to be the photographable spot for clients. The complex curved structure of the ceilings and the walls is intended to present a cleaner space, hiding all the necessary pipes inside.

title: 231㎡气质高级黑，简约时尚、格调十足！
text:
黑色拥有谦虚与傲慢两种特质，黑色是慵懒随性却神秘莫测的，黑色是一种最有态度的颜色，它分明在表达：我不烦你，你也别烦我。
家不仅是一个生活空间，更是居住者品味和身份的体现。黑色空间就如一位彬彬有礼的绅士，睿智而低调，高雅且谦和。
当高级黑与质感肌理岩板相遇，看似没有温度的外表下，隐藏着细腻与温暖。
在光的拥抱下，各种不同质感的黑色呈现出丰富的表情，随着光线变化，给空间以惊喜。
黑色、灰色体现绅士的品格与克制，窗帘那一抹红传递空间的温暖。灰色系的软装搭配，刚柔并进，更显空间的雅士与平和。
暗黑色调加以金属点缀，沉稳、温暖，极强的质感，是明亮空间里无法带来的优雅和神秘感。
南北通透的布局、白色石膏板吊顶、灰色墙面，设计师恰当地运用灯光与色彩的关系，赋予沉闷空间生气。
无论是大面宽的场景，还是谨小慎微的细节，每个角度都是极致完美。
开放式格局让生活多了更多的可能，不同材质在设计师手中运用自如，带来层次丰富的视觉感受。
家是心灵的港湾，安静的日子里，小酌一杯威士忌，享受酒入喉的超脱，慢慢品味惬意人生。
主卧室以大面积灰构成温文尔雅的心情居所，大型皮雕将雅致与浪漫和谐统一。原皮原毛材质带给空间丰富的表情，源于地域与城市维度特点，是北纬42度生活内容的包裹。
一抹橙色于空间中，像一位绅士的袖口，温文尔雅中又带着些许的幽默。
点燃生活的激情与热烈，法拉利质感的线条与金属碰撞出时尚与品质感。
设计是一种态度，精确到每一毫米，不仅是空间气质的深化，更是一个设计者应有的素质。
项目名称：金泰中央公园上叠样板间
设计团队：陈爽/李秀明/权威
摄影师：Mconcept
一然设计 设计总监/创始人
一然设计创始人，2010年先后创立一然设计沈阳、深圳公司。一然设计作品善用丰富的色彩惊爆眼球，精致的细节触动内心，对空间、色彩、体验都有独到的见解。一然设计的作品具有独特的识别与记忆性，备受瞩目，并获得诸多国内外大奖及专业人士的认可，被誉为房地产销售的设计引擎。 一然推崇设计美学与实用功能结合，通过戏剧手法解读用户内心世界，用极具张力的色彩和精致细节，演绎符合当代审美情趣的空间设计。深耕顶级商业地产、售楼处、样板间、顶级豪宅领域的设计、研发与定制服务，代表作品屡获国际国内专业奖项殊荣。

title: Hitotomori Architects丨理发店丨Atelier Toiro Salon
text:
This is a hair salon started by two women who named the salon ‘atelier toiro’. ‘Toiro’ literally means 10 colors, but it is symbolic of variety and diversity.  It is also a type of word play which represents ‘+ color’. The salon owners explained to us that they imagined a space which would allow people with various personalities and experiences to all have their talents flourish.In truth, I had thought that hair design was focused on the surface appearance of the hair. I was deeply impressed to learn that it is only through the careful treatment and care of the scalp, roots, and underlying hair—the underlying base— which allows for a hairstyle to maintain the beauty which is visible to us.We took this idea of the importance of creating an underlying base in order to allow talents to truly flourish as the essential spirit of toiro.
With this idea in mind, we kept the precisely aligned LGS, concrete, ALC, insulation materials,reinforcing panels, terrazzo, and larch pine boards and left them exposed as an essential component of the interior design in order to create a space which, ‘internally aligned, beautifully expresses its true personality.’ In addition, we recessed two openings approximately two meters from the building facade to create the impression of the hair salon being independent from the building. Setting back the salon’s entry also opened up the space underneath the shop’s eaves to the city and allowed it to blend with the surrounding neighborhood. 
While this type of interior is not well known, the salon owners acceptance of the beauty of the  building’s substrate—commonly acknowledged by architects—has resulted in a salon in which each of the many customers’ originality and individuality can be brought to the surface and sent out into the world.

title: 序曲的房子(2019)(Idle Architecture Studio)设计
text:
Houses, India
设计师：Thought Parallels
 面积：  10000 ft²
年份：2019
摄影：Ashik Aseem
建造商： Blum, Hafele, Legrand, Minotti, Mitsubishi Electric, Philippe Starck, Villeroy & Boch, Art legends, Flos, Hans Grohe, Nolte, Saint-Gobain
设计团队：Nikhil Mohan, Shabna Nikhil,  Akshay, Jithin, Najeera, Aparna, Jinesh, Faazil
业主：Mehaboob Ayani
Content Writer:Moxa Sheth
Engineering & Construction:Hascon construction
Country:India
The 10000 sq. ft. family home of the Ayanis is located in the leafy surrounds of Payyoli, Kerala - a state with unique culture and traditions, coupled with its varied topology. Mr. Ayani recently decided to branch off from the city to his native village where he could live close to his family and relatives. He believes that this home will be a part of their extended family environment. The family desired the expression of architects who could read the surrounding landscape and acknowledge the splendor of its essence. Their appreciation of the design process and the realization of the demands of the place made achievable dialogue between client and architects.
Intended to feature biophilic design, the house’s distinctive form echoes the traditional Malabar style architecture. It is partly inspired by the ‘tharavadu’ (traditional houses) of Kerala, a repository of the Indian culture. Westerly breezes are directed over the facade, creating a calm, protected zone on its leeward-side. The house’s primary form is created by a series of mild-steel frames in a bold expression of structure. Principals Shabna and Nikhil aim to integrate the environment to create graceful, life-enhancing spaces. They constantly draw on the littoral lifestyle, referencing the ancestral architecture, while creating a serene, coastal feel.
The stylistic analysis of the context is inspired by the classicism of casual modernism. From outside, the house has a peaceful quality; simple white walls with effortless openings. In many ways, it's like a person. Though deceivingly modest from the street view, the inside is colossal as a result of the way the design builds into the lush green landscape. The appearance of the house is adorned by details such as the courtyards, the segregation of the social and private spaces and the volumetric play of the interior ceilings. This gives integrity and individuality to each space. The programmatic allocation is simple, it consists of five bedrooms, a kitchen, a formal living-dining space, a family living-dining space and a covered parking. All this is unified in a single volume with the two courtyards that mark the difference between the social and private spaces, which are distributed through a central corridor.
Each introverted space is visually connected to the opulent exteriors, an approach to benefit health and well-being. “We want to nurture a family here. The kids should be able to play and the house should be welcoming for company..” The Ayanis are very particular about the division of social and family spaces. To cater to this need, willfully the social space has been positioned away from the family area. On entering the house, the main corridor provides an immediate view through to the two smaller courtyards. Hardwood screens have been installed to visually connect the indoors with the outdoors. Further, the design solution focused on the interaction of the family living-dining area with the large courtyard. The limits between interior and exterior spaces are diluted.
Nature is summoned into the house which becomes greener towards the large courtyard. In terms of materiality, the house exhibits elements that integrate it into the imagery of the location, recalling the traditional houses with variables that provide a modern touch without radically breaking with the aesthetics sought by the client. The interior work is mainly explored in search of a meaningful integration of shape, color, texture, and design, the entire space integrates the different planes and volumes. The overlay of Indian Teak Wood in contrast with the Kotah Stone creates a juxtaposition of subtle textures from the ceiling to the walls and floor, visually softens the project as a minimalist lavish residential space.
This along with a seemingly delicate steel structure, synergistically connects with the coastal environment to create a calm and concordant composition. The residence also includes a variety of renewable energy methods to curb energy consumption. A solar panel system has been incorporated to delve into the idea of sustainability. The landscape design preserves existing native species, aiding both the reduction of water use for irrigation and lowering temperatures with the surrounding vegetation. The ultimate goal is to create luminous living spaces with natural ventilation while simultaneously exploring the possibility of using renewable energy. An aspiration to achieve enduring spaces.
项目完工照片 | Finished Photos
设计师：Thought Parallels
分类：Houses
语言：英语
阅读原文

title: 原木风，如何设计出韵律美？
text:
Beauty of Simple White   Log Fusion
公领域开放通透之动线延伸至阳台，延展出介于室内外的共存空间，让阳光的温度落入整个公领域，光的穿透张力，成为公共区域定调空间的一个重要元素。
整体风格为减法的设计手法，没有过多的装饰，力求极简，带出材质最原始的面貌。
以白色基调为设计主体，凸显材质最自然的美感，并且围朔出纯净自然的空间氛围，另外将黑色铁件点缀式加入空间之中，增加空间的立体层次。
其开放式的公共场域赋予空间流畅的动线，公共场域一轴线的设计除了延伸视觉还为业主打造一个阅读疗愈身心的小天地。
俐落的线条分割白色背墙柜体，为阅读区增添现清新细腻的氛围，在不受限的空间里以白色基调放大空间的宽敞及明亮感，此案简洁俐落的设计中，给予居住者更多名为「自由」的幻想国度的想像。
本案本身具有采光良好的优势，其自然光与室内灯光具有调和空间光感之美，设计师的精心安排使其光线延绵洒落于室内每个角落。
空间色彩以白色为底蕴，包容着浅色木纹纹理、沉稳的清水模涂料相互作用于空间内，木质纹路清浅带出自然质感，为全室以白色机调的空间添一分温柔感受。
自然的中性色调使空间显得格外沉静，其家具物件选以黑白灰无色彩搭配纯静简洁的空间，诠释出空间力求自然极简的调性。

title: 天津 美域澜苑开放式设计家 | 深白设计
text:
本案业主王先生，和我们的这次合作，可以说是全网最省心的装修业主经历~因为工作和特殊疫情的影响，装修全程业主都在日本，整个项目从开始到最终落地，都由我们来操作实施。在项目沟通群里和王先生按时汇报进度，施工细节和后续主材家具产品都由我们去帮业主选样，拍照反馈，业主远程来确认最终产品，最后这个家落地后，获得王先生一家的一致好评，感谢信任，深白的全案托管模式能保证实物如图所见，而且省心省力~绝对是装修小白必选模式~
这个案子了解到业主夫妻都很年轻，长居日本，非常注重餐厅、浴室的舒适性，偏爱简洁的北欧风和日系风格，对设计的接受度很高。所以我们本案在满足特殊需求的设计下，还加入了特别的质感色调，全开放的设计，这个使用面积只有70平的小家质感非凡，让人印象深刻。
玄关
红色是热情的颜色
低饱和度红为整个空间注入质感的活力
入户的角度
悬空鞋柜和洞洞板
简单要素满足三口之家的收纳需求
红色墙面 不规则六角砖 木地板
材质变换间 空间也随之多了几分探寻趣味
进入客餐厅
能看到完全开放的公共区
餐厅放在客厅与厨房的中点
有弧度的餐桌
来自特殊定制 完美融入
墨绿墙面搭配大面积的木地面
令人舒适的绝佳配色
让整个空间
打开生活美的另一种可能
客厅的社交互动需求
通过这里来实现
原本的客厅竖向排列  空间使用率太低
设计师通过空间优化重构  将客厅面积扩充大半
集社交、休闲、用餐、阅读于一体
向阳的区域  百叶帘充分实现引光入室
沿墙面延伸的一组收纳柜
又能作为客厅的收纳还能是陈列展示区
一柜多用
和灯带 地毯组合
空间层次上有了柔和变化
大面积的彩色经常被排除使用
此处我们使用崭新的布局、灯光和材质
重新融合和使用
有质感的色彩赋予空间独特灵魂
夜晚工作  清晨早起
餐厅  “小面积也有巧设计”
完美利用入户转折的一面墙
设计师做了一组纯白体块的餐边柜
与红色墙面  色彩冲突之下
美感与实用毫不矛盾
屋主将心爱的摆件一件件摆放
平时的咖啡 下午茶
都有了独立的操作空间
有限空间  也有这么多的小心机
女主人喜欢的摆件与挂画   都可以安然陈列
极薄的黑色隔板处理  减少存在感
让整个空间轻盈不少
大理石台面  弧形边角
为了未来三口之家 小孩子使用更安全
王先生两口之家即将迎来小家的第三位成员
所以在设计上考虑到有娃家庭的生活习惯
是必须且有必要的
而从餐厅到厨房到儿童房
都是最短的距离
不论是烹饪用餐还是照看孩子
都能快速兼顾
坐在餐厅  可以看到儿童房
这里的台阶和活动移门
是儿童房和公共空间的灵活边界
孩子的安静睡眠区和大人的世界
这一扇小门 做了天然的分割
孩子的世界 被妥帖的温柔保护
简洁的大理石餐桌 盛放一家人的一日三餐
一家人聚在一起
平淡的日子里也闪着光
原本厨房是一个方正的格局
取消原本朝向后
空间扩增出来一个对称操作台
推拉门里是生活阳台 晾晒衣物
厨房里则是顶地柜结合的收纳系统
巨大的厨区收纳
使物品都收纳其中  空间更加宽广、流畅
没有太多的改动空间
布局固定的情况下
主卧的关注点在主人的使用习惯
吊灯满足晚间的随时照明
面积不大的卧室 通过严丝合缝的整墙柜体
实现男女主人的物品收纳
简洁的大衣柜与完美契合的书桌
卧室需要满足功能的设计
低调与实用主义
让整个空间耐看、经典
属于小孩子的空间
应该是不设限的百变可能
整间铺贴的木地板
让整个房间都是自由的玩耍空间
爬上爬下  随意折腾
榻榻米的设计 避免孩子坠床 使用更安全
尽管孩子还没出生
但是书桌一定是必备的
玩耍空间有了 阅读学习也不耽搁
顶高的书柜
孩子以后长大了 站起来就可以随手取书
书柜的另一种取用方式
有点有趣
打开百叶帘
明亮的阳光投入这个舒适的儿童房
业主的孩子还没出生
以后住进来
无论是陪睡和照看
榻榻米都是一个足够方便的选择
你能猜到
这个洗手间只有三平米
却神奇般的实现了彻底的三分离吗？
最外面是洗手台
推开门是马桶间  再推开是浴室
屋主一家人常年生活在日本
非常喜欢日式浴室的设计
所以我们也将三分离沿用在这里的设计上
巨大收纳和完整三分离
实现了浴室功能同步
洗手间利用3㎡有限空间
入目所见都是足足的收纳
左边的顶天立地柜子
木质壁龛和洗手盆下的柜子
蓝绿色背景墙  防水防腐 方便清洁
在很小的细节上
也兼顾实用性和美观的平衡
“家，是真正生活的地方
我们要它集合所有喜欢的元素
又不被风格所局限
设计完成这个家的过程
也是一点一点认清自己 认清生活的过程
这是我们所认为的家
也希望你们能喜欢这个家”

title: 主卧带开放浴室，一室户也能住出豪宅感
text:
vizn. 是一家创意工作室
专门从事效果图的概念设计
今天分享的这个案例就是他们的作品
整个室内空间用简约的设计手法
干净利落的线条，轻柔的色调
无一不体现着现代生活的品质感
玄关最吸引人视觉焦点的是一整排衣柜
这一设计将鞋子、衣服都归类的井井有条
浅灰色的沙发与红色单人沙发椅
中间是黑色地毯搭配黑色矩形茶几
横平竖直的线条勾勒出现代美
灰色的窗帘占满了整面墙
在满足了基本功能需求前提下
达到以少胜多、以简胜繁的装饰效果
可升降的幕布隐藏于吊顶中
厨房和餐厅位于客厅后方
开放式厨房利用大理石做防溅板
墙上的吊柜选用白色柜体搭配磨砂玻璃柜门
整个厨房看起来更加精炼、实用、简单
厨房旁边是一个小型酒窖
就能看到内部的恒温酒柜
餐厅介于厨房和客厅之间
白色的长桌可同时容纳 6 人一起用餐
最特别的是餐椅和顶部吊灯的设计
左右两边分为白色、原木色各三把靠椅
吊灯更像是四朵开放到不同程度的花
一张灰色双人床摆放在中间
衣帽间作为做床头背景墙
茶色的玻璃将内部空间若隐若现的展示出来
这样富有生活气息的场景
无形中就带来了温馨、舒适的氛围
利用抬高的地面和玻璃隔墙做区域划分
一眼就能看到内部的淋浴区、浴缸和洗漱区
米白色的主色调占据了整个卫生间
配上黑色的水龙头和毛巾架
带来一种平静和谐的感觉
无不体现出屋主人的品位与喜好
也带来了美好的视觉享受
拱形的墙裙围着休息区设计
摆放在一旁的「KAWS」雕塑
儿童房内还空出一大块区域
可以在柔软的地毯上随意玩耍
远处的秋千椅也是孩子很喜欢的设计
对每一个区域都进行了合理的分布
让内部空间看起来更加神秘

title: ADINJU丨教育建筑丨Container Campus of Jiangxinzhou Middle School
text:
In the middle of the Yangtze river is an island called Jiangxinzhou .  Here is the place established of our Temporary School that covers an area of 11,200 square meters and has a floor area of 2,872 square meters with teaching building covers an area of 1,720 square meters, administrative buildings 1,043 square meters, the guards and logistic office 72 square meters, a parkland 4,430 square meters.
Standing opposite the hustle and bustle of the western city, the tranquil island is also slightly changing to keep up with the development of urbanization. To develop the island, the middle school here will be replaced with the new campus of the famous Nanjing Jinling Middle School.
It is the island stands Our Temporary School that provide leaning place for students during reconstruction .To save cost and reduce construction areas, our school shares the existing playground and laboratory with a nearby primary school.
To save the construction time and guarantee students of entrance time, all buildings of our school were assembled by prefabricated container components.
All the prefabricated containers stand in three sides of a parkland which is served as an activity space. Studying in the prefabricated containers provide students with good learning environment.
Finally, the cost and time saved, yet, the Temporary School was built with high quality.

title: 彩色瓦的住宅(2020)(Krisna Cheung Architects)设计
text:
Houses, North Melbourne, Australia
设计师：Krisna Cheung Architects
 面积：  60 m²
年份：2020
摄影：Peter Bennetts
Contractor:Caedman Construction
Materials:Colour Perspex from Mitchell Plastic Aust. Garage door from Hormann (4D Doors)
Client:Rachel & Wallace Wong
Country:Australia
Now that Melbourne has experienced the world‐changing potency of a global viral pandemic, we might have a better appreciation of the world‐changing potential of an idea going viral. This project represents an effort to scale up a typology through viral repetition while maintaining architectural and design quality through imagination and playfulness. It is somewhat unique in that it is not a standalone project, but an organic progression from a prior successful design, which is arguably more representative of real‐world architectural practice. In 2016, we gratefully accepted the ArchiTeam Award in the commercial category for our Studio Garage, a typology‐busting project tackling an architectural solution to the problem of effectively working from home in a time when the “working from home” was still a relatively esoteric luxury reserved for executives with enough clout to negotiate flexible working arrangements, or small scale entrepreneurs in creative fields, such as musicians or architects.
In the Covid era, “working from home” has unceremoniously burst into mainstream consciousness, making the need for a functionally separate form within a residential site dedicated to commercial or professional activities, not a luxury, but almost a necessity, as harried working parents all over Melbourne can attest to. Our continuing development of this typology is an example of how to architecturally engage with this rapidly forced merging of residential and commercial design.
This new project, which we’ve whimsically named ‘Colour Shingle’, has the fascinating distinction of being right next door to the Studio Garage, a result of a neighbour’s covetous glances, evidence of the viral power of an idea given form. (Incidentally, the neighbour on the other side of the Studio Garage has also requested one.) It is not the only other backyard commercial project we have completed – we have been exploring and evolving this typology on narrow residential sites across North Melbourne, including our own home `Cubby office’ – but it is unique in being right next to a previous one.
The challenge of this particular project then was how to evolve an already successful design so that you don’t simply create a carbon copy, while still coming up with something that complemented the adjacent original design. To that end then, we’ve made the same key design choice to turn the external wall into a non‐structural, semi‐translucent façade, with the stairwell placed between the false wall.
项目完工照片 | Finished Photos
设计师：Krisna Cheung Architects
分类：Houses
语言：英语
阅读原文

title: 90㎡极简私宅，轻奢优雅！
text:
BODES Studio设计新作，面积90㎡的私人住宅位于莫斯科，空间素净简约的色调，高档细腻的材质激发非凡大气的视觉触感，黄铜色金属与部分色彩局部告别平静气氛，倾注一份轻快灵动的美感。
客厅灰色的布艺沙发，黄铜色的茶几，曲线形状的艺术吊灯，不同材质释放的灵魂在空间之中糅杂成景，透过材质本身传达温润、温暖的空间感受。
餐厨一体，厨房配有内置电器，橱柜的表面尽可能与墙面融合，黄色的餐椅和黄铜色相呼应，流动的美态本身就具有让人离不开视线的艺术张力。
餐厅旁边设计师利用窗前的位置设计成一个休闲空间，光线充足，看着视觉上还是让人感觉挺放松，享受生活的平淡温馨的小幸福。
玄关素雅的色调简洁大方，深色的石头地板与客厅的木地板形成鲜明对比，一旁是内置的镜子和收纳柜，配以深蓝色换鞋凳，自然大方，看着舒服。
卫生间整体以浅灰色磁砖为主，黑色的金属搭配，干湿分离，时尚质感的灯光渲染，让整个空间更有艺术感。
主卧采用蓝白色调为主，蕴含着舒适与慵懒，丝毫没有违和感，渐渐安抚了一天的浮躁，终于能静下神来，感受其中的静谧和光明。
卧室进门位置设计师利用床头的背景设计一个简易衣帽间，可以存放小物品，纺织饰品的装饰，营造出最舒适宜人的氛围。
主卫通过规划分割，完美实现功能与美感的结合，盎然有趣。
PROJECT TEAM
BODES Studio，俄罗斯室内设计机构，
专注于高级住宅和乡村领域的室内设计及陈设，设计风格以简约为主，不仅重视细节的创新和漂亮的画面，还重视给人以家一般的舒适感。
这间103㎡的私人住宅同样 B
ODES Studio最新的设计作品，位于莫斯科，整个空间简洁干净，设计师以原有的空间布局，以优化空间为主要任务。
蓝色的电视背景墙作为半隔断，把客厅的厨房分隔开，设计师使用了浅灰色的沙发和窗帘，木色的栅栏墙面，
原木色的木地板，简约的艺术吊灯，
餐厅区域靠一侧光线充足，特色的餐厅配以简约艺术吊灯，有形的美感随即散发而出。
休闲区域，整体风格色调与客厅相协调，看着视觉上还是让人感觉挺放松。
一进门就能感受一种高级的美感，玄关打造了一个蓝色简约桌子，简约灰的换鞋凳，两盏吊灯，美观大方。
书房面积不大，但大大的落地窗，通透敞亮。
儿童房，粗犷而且充满了趣味性，略带中性的色调给人一种放松的状态，灰调板材和原木的纹理很好的融合在一起，构成视觉上的整体美。
卫生间维持浴室整体环境的整洁美观，设计简洁干练，以实用为主。

title: AUBE CONCEPTION丨教育建筑丨Shenzhen Haixi Primary School
text:
With integrated, organic and open academic buildings setting a prevailing new trend in Shenzhen, campus building design no longer rigidly adheres to the conventional layout. Instead, it now focuses more on integration with communities to address the land shortage for urban public functions. While academic buildings within the urban area are mostly challenged by limited site or more needs for renovation than new construction etc., new school projects in urban periphery primarily have to consider how to utilize surrounding resources, enhance urban image along the roads and rationally provide integrated functions in campus design.
Shenzhen Haixi (Future) Primary School is located in Dameisha resort in Yantian District, with Shenzhen’s renowned tourist destination OCT East on the north, large shopping mall and Vanke Center on the south, and residential districts on the east and west. Favorably sited in Dameisha resort, the campus enjoys rich landscape resources including the high mountain ranges of OCT East, and the southern artificial lake and sea views. Apart from designing a primary school for 30 classes, 497 public parking spaces also need to be provided. Due to the transition from a conventional “enclosed campus” to “a campus with educational facilities open to the public”, the design also needs to incorporate available surrounding resources, explore alternating functions during different time periods for campus spaces and study the corresponding management mode.
The seemingly ordinary public parking functions provided on B1 and B2, in fact, affects building layout in a number of ways. After comparison of multiple layout options, the site is divided into east and west parts. Building volumes are mostly concentrated and orderly arranged in a rectangular area in the east part to maintain the original extension of urban space in longitudinal direction. A 200m standard track is provided in a triangular area in the west section along with several outdoor basketball courts and other sports areas. The multi-purpose building right opposite the playground is designed with large steps under the elevated lecture hall for relaxation and game watching.
The orthogonal grid design skillfully balances maximum parking spaces and flexible building layout. The entrance and exit of the parking spaces are separately provided on the existing municipal road on the east and the planned municipal road on the north to avoid traffic congestion. BOH services, all-weather playground, administrative buildings and other spaces for non-teaching purposes are distributed along the noisy traffic interface on the northeast. In this way, noises can also be blocked. Extending to the east and joining the multi-purpose building, they together form the main entrance to the campus. Three rows of teaching buildings are arranged in an E shape in the south. A half-enclosed inner courtyard is planned to face the better landscaped west side, creating spaces for activities. Meanwhile, buildings along the east roadside can remain holistic, establishing a continuous urban interface.
An S-shape building corridor extending from south to north integrates and connects key nodes in the teaching, administrative and BOH areas, creating a multi-level system featuring individual and series of highlights. It also links up the dynamic square at the east main entrance, and the tranquil west-oriented inner courtyards between the sports area and the teaching buildings. Various courtyards are interconnected and integrated via elevated corridors, upgrading the conventional campus traffic spaces into major relaxation, interaction and viewing spaces for students. With such highly-integrated functional design, a highly recognizable new campus is established.
Campus buildings present a bright and warm overall appearance. The continuous east facade uses grating as a consistent architectural language, conveying an introverted campus style. The multi-purpose building facade, by adjusting grating size and interval, improves recognizability and provides easy orientation and way-finding, thus enhancing the public nature of the entrance space. The teaching building facade facing the playground is designed with semi-outdoor stairs, with bright colors of handrail design on the inner side. This not only injects fun elements into the buildings specially designed for elementary school students but also enhances the students’ sense of belonging in different teaching buildings.
Campus parking and public parking functions alternate during different time periods. On weekdays, school vehicles and pedestrian access are prioritized and the public parking spaces mainly serve parents picking up/dropping off students. During holidays, public vehicles to tourist destinations are prioritized to relieve tourist traffic burden. The alternating parking functions during different time periods can be managed relatively independently. In this way, the infrastructure also reciprocates tourist resources, thus realizing harmonious coexistence of school and public parking spaces.

title: 壹阁设计 x 作『Principle』
text:
「Principle」
Balancing Art and Science - One Space Design
轻奢，便是舍弃繁琐，以更简洁、硬朗的线条替代，从而彰显出一种更高品质的生活方式。
Luxury is to abandon complex elements, instead of more concise and rigid straight lines, thus showing a high-quality lifestyle.
不论是哪种风格，色彩对空间风格走向的重要性都是不言而喻的；
Colours, rather than styles, plays an important role in trend and mood.
在本次案例我们使用白色加上绿植的点缀，增加了些许的生命力。
In this case, we use white as the base to create an advanced but warm experience for the user.
We use metal, marble, leather products and other materials to highlight the higher quality of the space;
室外光线透过百叶窗，零星的光给予空间更多的律动性、更加的舒适的体验...
Outdoor light shines through window shutter creating sporadic light gives the space more delicate, comfortable experience.
